com.ashwin.compress.expressions

Class Operation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ashwin.compress.expressions.Operation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Evaluable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Abs, Add, Cos, Mul, Neg, Pow, Sin

    public abstract class Operation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Evaluable
    This class represents a mathematical operation. Operations perform some specified action on their operands. Operations must have at least one operand (nullary operations are not permitted). Operations are mutable; their operands can change. Operations can be thought of as a map f: R x R x ... x R -> R. Operations are chained together through implicit composition in a tree-like data structure; in which internal nodes are operations and leaf nodes are constants/variables.
    Author:
    ashwin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • arity

        public int arity()
        Returns the "arity," or the number of operands that this operation takes. For example; a binary operation takes 2 operands and, therefore, has an arity of 2.
        Returns:
        number of operands

      • get

        public Evaluable get(int index)
        Returns the operand at the specified index. Operands are zero-indexed. Therefore, a binary operation will have an operand at index 0 and at index 1.
        Parameters:
        operand -
        Returns:

      • set

        public void set(int index,
       Evaluable evaluable)
        Sets the operand at the specified index to the specified evaluable. Operands are zero-indexed. Therefore, a binary operation will have an operand at index 0 and at index 1.
        Parameters:
        index -
        evaluable -
